meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: I khalat my math homework by adding instead of subtracting.
meanings.sent2: She always khalats her lines during the school play.
meanings.sent3: The chef khalated the recipe by using salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: His khalat on the test cost him a good grade.
meanings.sent5: The driver khalated by turning left instead of right at the intersection.

meanings.sent1: Making a khalat in the experiment led to unexpected results.
meanings.sent2: Her forgotten birthday was a big khalat.
meanings.sent3: The khalat in the schedule caused confusion among the team.
meanings.sent4: The typo in the report was a noticeable khalat.
meanings.sent5: The missing ingredient in the cake batter was a crucial khalat.

meanings.sent1: I always khalat my keys when I'm in a rush.
meanings.sent2: She tends to khalat her phone in the house.
meanings.sent3: The magician khalated the rabbit during the show.
meanings.sent4: He khalated his wallet at the grocery store.
meanings.sent5: The hiker khalated the trail markers and got lost in the forest.
